alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harlan, east central Bell and southeastern Leslie Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kentenia, or near Harlan, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... White Star, Teetersville and Mary Alice around 200 PM EDT. Harlan, Loyall, Sunshine, Tway, Elcomb, Baxter, Grays Knob, Lenarve, Three Point and Martins Fork Lake around 205 PM EDT. Golden Ash, Kitts, Clovertown, Coxton, Rosspoint, Harlan Gas, Chevrolet, Bobs Creek, Bledsoe and Crummies around 210 PM EDT. Ages, Kildav and Verda around 215 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Evarts, Putney, Bailey Creek, Darkmont, Short Town, Colts, Kenvir, Black Mountain, Dizney, Napier, Nolansburg, Pine Mountain, Shields and Big Laurel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
